results.title: The Bank of England
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Ian Dalrymple and Wessex Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the many aspects of the Bank’s life; the traditions and premises, the hierarchy and staff; meetings of the Court and committees; the work of certain departments such as the printing works. An intricate machine and the people who operate it have been skillfully photographed. Includes the Guard, the Sports Club, and the exterior of several branches. Indirectly the historical aspects are portrayed.

results.title: Rob Roy
results.creator_credit: Michael Caton-Jones, Richard Jackson, Peter Broughan and Talisman
results.brief_description: When a harsh winter threatens the majestic Scottish Highlands, Robert Roy McGregor (Liam Neeson) is forced to borrow money from the not so noble Marquis of Montrose (John Hurt) to provide for his clan. But when Montrose’s evil henchmen (brilliantly portrayed by Tim Roth and Brian Cox) conspire to take the wealth for themselves, they thrust Rob into the most challenging battle of his life, one that escalates into a bloody and gripping climax. Breathtaking landscapes, steamy romance and non-stop action combine to make this a thrilling and powerful adventure.

results.title: Presumed innocent
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula, Mark Rosenberg, Sydney Pollack and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: This courtroom drama based on the Scott Turow novel of the same name contains murder, sex and intrigue. It stars Harrison Ford as the prosecutor, Rusty Sabich, who is asked to investigate the murder of a colleague. He is reluctant to do so because he has had a previous affair with her. What follows is a twisted tale of suspense and surprise. Supporting cast includes Brian Dennehy, Raul Julia, Bonnie Bedelia, Paul Winfield and Greta Scacchi. Music by John Williams.

results.title: Death on the Nile
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, Richard Goodwin, John Brabourne and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: A star-studded cast features in this version of a great Agatha Christie classic story. Peter Ustinov stars as the famous Belgian detective Hercule Poirot investigating the murder of rich American heiress Lynette Ridgeway on board a Nile steamer. All the passengers including her newly acquired husband have reason to want her dead and it is Poirot who puts “his little grey cells” to work and solves the mystery. Beautifully costumed, starring Jane Birkin, Lois Chiles, Bette Davis, Mia Farrow, Jon Finch, Olivia Hussey, I.S. Johar, George Kennedy, Angela Lansbury, Simon MacCorkindale, David Niven, Maggie Smith and Jack Warden.

results.title: Bullets over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Sweetland Films BV and Magnolia Productions
results.brief_description: A struggling writer gets the opportunity of his life to stage his latest play on Broadway. There is one catch however: he must cast the untalented mistress of a notorious gangster in the lead role. Overwhelmed by the chance of success, he overlooks critical factors looming in the wings, including a player who can’t act, a leading lady wanting to steal the spotlight, a leading man who is a compulsive eater and the gangster’s bodygaurd who wants to rewrite the play. Set in the 1920’s, Woody Allen’s film is enhanced by an excellent atmospheric soundtrack. The cast includes John Cusack, Mary-Louise Parker, Jennifer Tilly, Tracey Ullman, and Academy Award winner Dianne Wiest.

results.title: Pret-a-porter = Ready to wear
results.brief_description:
Every year in Paris, the top designers and supermodels stage the world’s hottest fashion show. It is called “Pret-a-Porter” and it means “Ready to Wear”. Only this time, there has been a murder and everyone is a suspect. Once again Altman gathers a remarkable ensemble cast of stars and celebrities to weave an elaborate interlocking web of stories and events. High fashion is subjected to the critical glare and ironic wit typical of Altman’s films, in this tangled tale of sex and sin, designed to seduce and dressed to kill.
Cast includes: Marcello Mastroianni, Sophia Loren, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Kim Basinger, Anouk Aimee, Rupert Everett, Lili Taylor, Forest Whitaker, Richard E. Grant, Julia Roberts, Tim Robbins, Lauren Bacall, Lyle Lovett, Tracey Ullman, Sally Kellerman, Teri Garr, Danny Aiello, Harry Belafonte, Cher, and an array of famous designers and models appearing as themselves.

results.title: The Blue kite
results.brief_description: The fate of a Beijing family under Mao Tse Tung’s regime from the early 1950’s to the Cultural Revolution is the focus of this film by talented filmaker Tian Zhuangzhuang. Seen from the perspective of Tietou who grows from child to adolescence as he observes his mother’s three marriages. Although epic in proportion, the intimacy of domestic life is a poignant contrast to the political dramas occuring. The film was banned in China but a print was smuggled out of the country allowing the rest of the world an opportunity to experience this inspirational human drama.

results.title: Interview with a vampire: the vampire chronicles (S)
results.creator_credit: Geffen Pictures, David Geffen, Stephen Woolley and Neil Jordan
results.brief_description: The first of Anne Rice’s “Vampire Chronicles” was brought to the screen by Neil Jordan. Despite initial public misgivings, Tom Cruise is convincingly seductive and evil as the Vampire Lestat. Brad Pitt plays Louis, the narrator of the strange history of his journey into immortality as a vampire. These two are ably supported by an all star cast including Christian Slater, Antonio Banderas, Kirsten Dunst and Stephen Rea. Jordan’s film is visually striking and sensual; so much so that the viewer is often torn between a world full of blood and horror and the allurement of immortality and the supernatural.

results.title: Siegfried
results.brief_description: The young God Siegfried, the subject of famed Teutonic legend achieves immortality by bathing in the blood of a slain dragon; one of the hallmark scenes in the history of silent film. An evocative film typical of Lang’s genius which deals with the theme of the extra-personal forces which shape the destiny of humans in a way they cannot always predict or control. “Siegfried” was a nationalistic triumph for Lang and an international success. A classic not to be missed.

results.title: Street fighter II: the animated movie
results.creator_credit: Gisaburo Sugii, Kenichi Imai and Capcom Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the popular video game of the same name. Human civilisation is under attack in the not so distant future. Bison is the evil mastermind who leads the forces of evil and wants to take possession of the world’s best fighters so he can use them to conquer the world. Ken and Ryu are the only two humans in the world with the skill and strength to stop them. What ensues is a mighty battle in the classic clash between the forces of good and evil.
